Respectfully submitted,
dimic63

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 26
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Hi,

i tried Tor Browser before and i could manually update the integrated firefox to the newest version. Now i downloaded 1.3.9 and firefox tells me that there are no updates available e.g. i cannot update it.

So now i hesitate to use Tor Browser because any of the security issues Mozilla fixed with the last releases seems to be relevant to my Tor integrated firefox 5.x now. Everywhere it is said: Use the newest firefox release cause there are security relevant fixes in it. So i don`t understand, why there is a firefox version needed in Tor browser which is out of date and therefor considered "unsafe". As i don`t have the ability to install the non portable version for some reason, any help would be much appreciated.

Am i understanding soemething wrong?

item.title: phobos: Comment 27
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description:
We ship with 3.5.x because it's the last branch we've analyzed for anonymity and privacy exploits. We're analyzing 3.6.x

As for why not include 3.5.12, we need to build new TBBs. We're working on this.

Linux TBB has been testing with 3.6.x series, and we'll likely update the Windows TBB to 3.6.x too.

You should be able to drop in the latest Portable Firefox 3.5.12, and put in our config.js file.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 28
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Thanks

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 29
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
[16:36:02] Your Computer's Clock is Potentially Incorrect - Tor has determined that your computer's clock may be set to 3292 seconds in the past compared to the source "DIRSERV:88.208.121.151:9030". If your clock is not correct, Tor will not be able to function. Please verify your computer displays the correct time.

How do I fix this? The time on my computer is correct. Why am I getting this ~1 hour error? It seems the only way I can fix it is to reboot. But then I lose my online longevity. I noted someone else had a similar problem but got no reply.

item.title: phobos: Comment 30
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: It appears the relay has incorrect time. You can ignore the error if you are sure your time is correct.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 31
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
I downloaded the TOR Bundle to a USB drive (flash drive), where I also keep several other important files unrelated to TOR. I have those files there so they are 'off my computer' and more secure.

By putting TOR on the same flash drive, am I jeopardizing the security of these other files? While I am using TOR off the flash drive, could some evil doer somehow gain access to other files? Is that technically possible? Sorry if this is a dumb question. I am new to TOR. Thanks in advance.
